alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex; Franklin; St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 29 at 8:46PM EDT until March 29 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southern Clinton County in northern New York... Southeastern Franklin County in northern New York... Southeastern St. Lawrence County in northern New York... Western Essex County in northern New York... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 844 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Madawaska to 17 miles south of Horseshoe Lake, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 149 and 150. Locations impacted include... Tupper Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Peru, Schuyler Falls, Wilmington, Keene, Newcomb, Wawbeek, Clayburg, Keene Valley, Au Sable Forks, Mount Marcy, Peasleeville, Jay In Essex County, North Elba, Harrietstown, Black Brook and Paul Smiths. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
